item.title: R Packages: {janitor} for Data Cleaning

item.title: Quick Tips for Data Cleaning in R
item.description: Data Cleaning (istockphoto) What to Expect Iâ€™m excited to share pro-tips that will expedite your process for cleaning and standardizing column names in your data; this is a critical yet sometimes overlooked step in the cleaning + tidying of data. There are a couple of handy functions() available in R to help effectively execute these tasks. By the end of this short article youâ€™ll have a couple of new tricks up your sleeve for getting those column names just the way you want them ðŸ˜Ž

item.title: Business Ready Plots with R
item.description: Quick Overview Recently, I completed the Data Science for Business 101 course over at Business Science University. In the course, Matt Dancho teaches students the fundamentals of data science for business with the tidyverse. The course is jam packed with material: from basic data wrangling all the way to applied machine learning - I highly recommend it to anyone looking to advance their skills ðŸ¤“ Clink this LINK to access the course.
